Murder.synopsis: An NPC noticed a murder scene, or was told about a murder by another NPC, and is interrogating a suspected player.

PickPocketNoticed.synopsis:
An NPC was pickpocketed, and someone is interrogating a suspected player about it.
-- Can check the GEB_Crime_IsVictim flag on speaker 1 to distinguish the NPC from being the victim or a witness of the crime.

Charmed.synopsis: An NPC was charmed/dominated, then the charm/domination wore off and they started looking for who did this to them, and is now interrogating a suspected player about this.
Charmed.how_to_trigger: - addDebugSpell Target_CharmPerson- Use the Charm Person spell on an unsuspecting NPC- Wait until the spell wear off- NPC will then confront player/party

Polymorphed.synopsis: An NPC was polymorphed/transmuted, then the polymorph wore off and they started looking for who did this to them, and is now interrogating a suspected player about this.
Polymorphed.how_to_trigger: loadlevel WLD_Main_Ateleport S_PLA_FlamingFist8startDialog [dialog name] [npc] [player]ctrl + click on character to find npc/player ideg: startDialog NGB_Interrogation_Polymorphed_b49cfff0-408e-db7a-aaa0-f564eaada8bf S_PLA_FlamingFist8Elves_Female_High_Player

TeleportPlayer.synopsis: An NPC was speaking with a player, and then the player got teleported out of sight from the NPC. At that point, the dialog gets stopped and the NPC starts investigating. When they notice a player, they will start this dialog.

Vandalise.synopsis: An NPC noticed a destroyed item, or was told about it by another NPC, and is interrogating a suspected player.

DisarmingTrap.synopsis: An NPC noticed a trap being disarmed, or was told about it by another NPC, and is interrogating a suspected player.
DisarmingTrap.how_to_trigger: - goto 268.54, 41.12, 12.33- Disarm the trap on Brakkal's cage- NPC will confront player

Assault.synopsis: An NPC was told about an assault by another NPC, or was assaulted but did not see who attacked them so they started to investigate, and is interrogating a suspected player.

individual_metadata.synopsis: An NPC noticed a crime scene, or was told about a crime by another NPC, and is interrogating a suspected player.

Steal.synopsis: An NPC noticed a theft, or was told about a theft by another NPC, and is interrogating a suspected player.

Murder_22.speaker: Narrator
Murder_22.text: *A body has been discovered. You're accused of being the cause of death.*

Murder_15.speaker: Player
Murder_15.text: It was me - I'm the killer.

Murder_7.speaker: Narrator
Murder_7.text: *Your admission just booked you a trip to the cells.*

Murder_26.speaker: Narrator
Murder_26.text: *It appears that this crime is to be your last.*

Murder_14.speaker: Player
Murder_14.text: I don't know anything about it.

Murder_6.speaker: Narrator
Murder_6.text: *You successfully protest your innocence. It looks like you're free to go.*

Murder_5.speaker: Player
Murder_5.text: Try and talk your way out of this.

Murder_10.speaker: Player
Murder_10.text: I've been asked to investigate. Leave this with me.

Murder_0.speaker: Narrator
Murder_0.text: *You'll walk free, for now, but your stories won't land so well if you're caught again.*

Murder_2.speaker: Narrator
Murder_2.text: *You deflect the accusation, and are free to go on your murderous way once more.*

Murder_24.speaker: Narrator
Murder_24.text: *Your words only make you appear more guilty. You can't be allowed to walk free.*

Murder_4.speaker: Narrator
Murder_4.text: *Your lies have been seen through - your crime won't go unpunished.*
Murder_4.context: NodeContext: Failed persuasion, player is attacked

Murder_13.speaker: Player
Murder_13.text: If I was the murderer, I'd be more than happy to gut you next.

Murder_18.speaker: Player
Murder_18.text: Come, now - do I look like a killer?

Murder_19.speaker: Player
Murder_19.text: I'm sure we can straighten this out. ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_6057ad05-9492-4630-9f0a-be548b134c54])

Murder_17.speaker: Narrator
Murder_17.text: *Improperly-acquired coin weighs heavy on the conscience. The bribe may have worked this time, but it won't work the next.*

Murder_9.speaker: Narrator
Murder_9.text: *It appears this was nothing more than an unfortunate accident.*
Murder_9.context: NodeContext: Don't allow infinite bribing for murders, not even for civilians

Murder_3.speaker: Narrator
Murder_3.text: *You don't have the gold to buy your way out of this situation.*
Murder_3.context: NodeContext: Don't allow infinite bribing for murders, not even for civilians

Murder_16.speaker: Narrator
Murder_16.text: *If you didn't seem guilty before, you certainly do now. Turn yourself in, or face the consequences.*
Murder_16.context: NodeContext: NPC moves to arrest player

Murder_12.speaker: Narrator
Murder_12.text: *It seems you can't buy your way out of this.*

PickPocketNoticed_9.speaker: Narrator
PickPocketNoticed_9.text: *A thief's been emptying pockets around here. You might want to allay some suspicions, before things get out of hand.*

PickPocketNoticed_5.speaker: Player
PickPocketNoticed_5.text: I'm sorry - I'll return what was stolen.

PickPocketNoticed_26.speaker: Narrator
PickPocketNoticed_26.text: *You hand over the spoils of your pilfering. No harm done.*

PickPocketNoticed_15.speaker: Narrator
PickPocketNoticed_15.text: *Your honesty isn't enough. At least the loot won't weigh you down as you walk to the cells.*

PickPocketNoticed_22.speaker: Narrator
PickPocketNoticed_22.text: *You give up the loot, but it's too late for that. A fight is brewing - one you might not want to surrender so easily...*

PickPocketNoticed_24.speaker: Player
PickPocketNoticed_24.text: I assure you I've committed no crime.

PickPocketNoticed_0.speaker: Narrator
PickPocketNoticed_0.text: *You have a convincing air of innocence about you. That's enough for now.*

PickPocketNoticed_20.speaker: Player
PickPocketNoticed_20.text: Try to talk your way out of the situation.

PickPocketNoticed_7.speaker: Player
PickPocketNoticed_7.text: How dare you accuse me? I'm a victim too!

PickPocketNoticed_4.speaker: Narrator
PickPocketNoticed_4.text: *You'll walk free, for now, but your stories won't land so well if you're caught again.*

PickPocketNoticed_6.speaker: Narrator
PickPocketNoticed_6.text: *You speak with conviction. Whoever did this, it obviously wasn't you.*

PickPocketNoticed_2.speaker: Narrator
PickPocketNoticed_2.text: *Your silver tongue won't get you out of trouble this time. You're clearly the guilty party.*

PickPocketNoticed_18.speaker: Narrator
PickPocketNoticed_18.text: *You try your best, but your best just isn't good enough. Things are about to turn ugly.*

PickPocketNoticed_27.speaker: Player
PickPocketNoticed_27.text: Are the contents of one little pocket really your top priority?

PickPocketNoticed_16.speaker: Player
PickPocketNoticed_16.text: How's about I step up that pickpocketing charge to a murder one?

PickPocketNoticed_12.speaker: Player
PickPocketNoticed_12.text: This donation will make up for whatever was stolen. ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_6057ad05-9492-4630-9f0a-be548b134c54])

PickPocketNoticed_1.speaker: Narrator
PickPocketNoticed_1.text: *Improperly-acquired coin weighs heavy on the conscience. The bribe may have worked this time, but it won't work the next.*

PickPocketNoticed_8.speaker: Narrator
PickPocketNoticed_8.text: *A quick transaction, and your problem is miraculously resolved.*

PickPocketNoticed_10.speaker: Narrator
PickPocketNoticed_10.text: *Your lack of wealth might make bribing this individual rather difficult.*

PickPocketNoticed_11.speaker: Narrator
PickPocketNoticed_11.text: *Your attempted bribery has cost you far more than gold. You're being locked up for good.*

PickPocketNoticed_14.speaker: Narrator
PickPocketNoticed_14.text: *Your guilt is only compounded by your attempted bribery. This will be resolved here and now.*

Charmed_8.speaker: Narrator
Charmed_8.text: *This is the victim of some potent magic. It seems the hunt is on for the one responsible - tread carefully.*

Charmed_1.speaker: Player
Charmed_1.text: I played no part in this mischief. Now leave me be.

Charmed_20.speaker: Narrator
Charmed_20.text: *The situation is quickly resolved. Clearly you're not the one responsible.*

Charmed_22.speaker: Player
Charmed_22.text: Try to talk your way out of it.

Charmed_30.speaker: Player
Charmed_30.text: Come now. I have no need to cast a spell to charm someone. I can achieve that all by myself.

Charmed_14.speaker: Player
Charmed_14.text: Maybe I'm forcing you to challenge me, so I have an excuse to kill you...

Charmed_6.speaker: Player
Charmed_6.text: I don't actually know that spell. Skipped my studies that day, I'm afraid.

Charmed_2.speaker: Player
Charmed_2.text: Go on, accuse me. I'll cast a spell to make you wish you'd never been born.

Charmed_27.speaker: Narrator
Charmed_27.text: *Your protestations have only confirmed your guilt. You're about to be arrested.*

Charmed_26.speaker: Narrator
Charmed_26.text: *You speak, but you are not listened to. This will only be decided one way: violently.*

Charmed_16.speaker: Narrator
Charmed_16.text: *You'll walk free, for now, but your stories won't land so well if you're caught again.*

Charmed_10.speaker: Narrator
Charmed_10.text: *You manage to resolve the matter. You will not be disturbed further.*

Charmed_17.speaker: Player
Charmed_17.text: Act as though under the influence of the same spell.

Charmed_25.speaker: Player
Charmed_25.text: Sounds like an act of mischief, but nothing more. Why waste your time further?

Charmed_36.speaker: Player
Charmed_36.text: Perhaps some gold might settle this matter? ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_6057ad05-9492-4630-9f0a-be548b134c54])

Charmed_32.speaker: Narrator
Charmed_32.text: *Improperly-acquired coin weighs heavy on the conscience. The bribe may have worked this time, but it won't work the next.*

Charmed_9.speaker: Narrator
Charmed_9.text: *The clink of gold leaving your purse - the sound of repercussions deftly avoided.*
Charmed_9.context: NodeContext: Don't allow infinite bribing for assault, not even for civilians

Charmed_5.speaker: Narrator
Charmed_5.text: *Your gold buys contempt, but not freedom. You're about to be detained.*

Charmed_21.speaker: Narrator
Charmed_21.text: *Your bribery has only made things worse. Your life is the only acceptable payment.*

Charmed_19.speaker: Player
Charmed_19.text: You got me. It was a fun spell while it lasted.

Charmed_12.speaker: Narrator
Charmed_12.text: *Unfortunately, your admission doesn't absolve you of your crimes. Only time in the cells will do that.*

Charmed_18.speaker: Narrator
Charmed_18.text: *You sense the pleasantries might be over. In fact, this could get very unpleasant indeed.*

Charmed_28.speaker: Narrator
Charmed_28.text: *Someone's been casting dangerous magic nearby. You're under suspicion - tread carefully.*

Polymorphed_13.speaker: Narrator
Polymorphed_13.text: *This is the victim of some potent magic. It seems the hunt is on for the one responsible - tread carefully.*

Polymorphed_1.speaker: Player
Polymorphed_1.text: I played no part in this mischief. Now leave me be.

Polymorphed_22.speaker: Narrator
Polymorphed_22.text: *The situation is quickly resolved. Clearly you're not the one responsible.*

Polymorphed_18.speaker: Player
Polymorphed_18.text: Try to talk your way out of it.

Polymorphed_30.speaker: Player
Polymorphed_30.text: That was a spell of false accusation! See, would you be here accusing me otherwise?

Polymorphed_19.speaker: Player
Polymorphed_19.text: Accuse me, and I'll transform you into a turkey, roast you, and eat you in your own gravy.

Polymorphed_11.speaker: Player
Polymorphed_11.text: They're not the only one. Have you looked in the mirror recently?

Polymorphed_2.speaker: Player
Polymorphed_2.text: Go on, accuse me. I'll cast a spell to make you wish you'd never been born.

Polymorphed_28.speaker: Narrator
Polymorphed_28.text: *Your protestations have only confirmed your guilt. You're about to be arrested.*

Polymorphed_26.speaker: Narrator
Polymorphed_26.text: *You speak, but you are not listened to. This will only be decided one way: violently.*

Polymorphed_38.speaker: Narrator
Polymorphed_38.text: *You'll walk free, for now, but your stories won't land so well if you're caught again.*

Polymorphed_15.speaker: Narrator
Polymorphed_15.text: *Your words resolve the matter. You will not be disturbed further.*

Polymorphed_25.speaker: Player
Polymorphed_25.text: What would I have to gain? Sure, it sounds hilarious, but I mean apart from that?

Polymorphed_35.speaker: Player
Polymorphed_35.text: Perhaps some gold might settle this matter? ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_6057ad05-9492-4630-9f0a-be548b134c54])

Polymorphed_36.speaker: Narrator
Polymorphed_36.text: *Improperly-acquired coin weighs heavy on the conscience. The bribe may have worked this time, but it won't work the next.*

Polymorphed_14.speaker: Narrator
Polymorphed_14.text: *The clink of gold leaving your purse - the sound of repercussions deftly avoided.*
Polymorphed_14.context: NodeContext: Don't allow infinite bribing for assault, not even for civilians

Polymorphed_10.speaker: Narrator
Polymorphed_10.text: *Your gold buys contempt, but not freedom. You're about to be detained.*

Polymorphed_12.speaker: Narrator
Polymorphed_12.text: *You don't have the gold to buy your way out of this situation.*

Polymorphed_23.speaker: Narrator
Polymorphed_23.text: *You're expected to pay with your life, not your gold.*

Polymorphed_21.speaker: Player
Polymorphed_21.text: You got me. It was a fun spell while it lasted.

Polymorphed_17.speaker: Narrator
Polymorphed_17.text: *Unfortunately, your admission doesn't absolve you of your crimes. Only time in the cells will do that.*

Polymorphed_20.speaker: Narrator
Polymorphed_20.text: *You sense the pleasantries might be over. In fact, this could get very unpleasant indeed.*

Polymorphed_29.speaker: Narrator
Polymorphed_29.text: *Someone's been casting dangerous magic nearby. You're under suspicion - tread carefully.*

TeleportPlayer_2.context: NodeContext: Need this node (with some text; could be dots if needed) for scripting reasons...

TeleportPlayer_3.speaker: Narrator
TeleportPlayer_3.text: *This individual is rather put out by your companion's sudden disappearance.*
TeleportPlayer_3.context: NodeContext: While these never directly lead to combat, if you teleported an NPC in the middle of a dialog that is normally followed by combat, that will still happen after this dialog ends, So it needs to be neutral, but not too friendly.

TeleportPlayer_0.speaker: Narrator
TeleportPlayer_0.text: *Suddenly vanishing and reappearing does not seem to be winning you any friends.*
TeleportPlayer_0.context: NodeContext: While these never directly lead to combat, if you teleported an NPC in the middle of a dialog that is normally followed by combat, that will still happen after this dialog ends, So it needs to be neutral, but not too friendly.

Vandalise_4.speaker: Narrator
Vandalise_4.text: *This child will benefit from reporting your vandalism, no doubt.*

Vandalise_13.speaker: Narrator
Vandalise_13.text: *An act of vandalism has taken place. You might want to clear up this particular mess.*

Vandalise_7.speaker: Narrator
Vandalise_7.text: *Alas, this child is a tell-tale. The grown-ups will love hearing this.*

Vandalise_20.speaker: Narrator
Vandalise_20.text: *You confess, but are not absolved. The guards will deal with you.*

Vandalise_31.speaker: Narrator
Vandalise_31.text: *Your confession won't fix the damage you caused. You're about to be locked up.*

Vandalise_18.speaker: Narrator
Vandalise_18.text: *Your confession is accepted. You can take comfort in dying with your conscience clean.*

Vandalise_15.speaker: Narrator
Vandalise_15.text: *Perhaps this child will live to maturity after all. You're being left alone.*

Vandalise_24.speaker: Player
Vandalise_24.text: I wouldn't know anything about that.

Vandalise_5.speaker: Narrator
Vandalise_5.text: *The situation is quickly resolved. Clearly you're not the one responsible.*

Vandalise_12.speaker: Player
Vandalise_12.text: Try to talk your way out of it.

Vandalise_26.speaker: Player
Vandalise_26.text: Probably a manufacturing fault. I can hardly be blamed for your shoddy belongings.

Vandalise_25.speaker: Player
Vandalise_25.text: How'd you like to get vandalised?

Vandalise_10.speaker: Narrator
Vandalise_10.text: *You'll walk free, for now, but your stories won't land so well if you're caught again.*

Vandalise_17.speaker: Narrator
Vandalise_17.text: *Perhaps it's best not to accuse you of this particular crime. As you were.*

Vandalise_9.speaker: Narrator
Vandalise_9.text: *You sense the guards will be hearing of this.*

Vandalise_3.speaker: Narrator
Vandalise_3.text: *You hope for a glimmer of understanding. No such luck. It's the cells for you.*

Vandalise_8.speaker: Narrator
Vandalise_8.text: *Your words only make you appear more guilty. You can't be allowed to walk free.*

Vandalise_29.speaker: Player
Vandalise_29.text: Can't we just sweep this under the rug, so to speak?

Vandalise_21.speaker: Player
Vandalise_21.text: Maybe a little gold would smooth this over? ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_6057ad05-9492-4630-9f0a-be548b134c54])

Vandalise_30.speaker: Narrator
Vandalise_30.text: *Improperly-acquired coin weighs heavy on the conscience. The bribe may have worked this time, but it won't work the next.*

Vandalise_23.speaker: Narrator
Vandalise_23.text: *Your gold was more than enough to defuse the situation. You're free to go.*

Vandalise_11.speaker: Narrator
Vandalise_11.text: *Perhaps you'd better earn some gold before you try giving it away to others.*

Vandalise_22.speaker: Narrator
Vandalise_22.text: *If you didn't seem guilty before, you certainly do now. Turn yourself in, or face the consequences.*

Vandalise_33.speaker: Narrator
Vandalise_33.text: *Only the guilty party would attempt such brazen bribery. If you're guilty, you should be punished.*

DisarmingTrap_9.speaker: Narrator
DisarmingTrap_9.text: *A disarmed trap has been discovered. You have a sneaking suspicion you're about to get the blame.*

DisarmingTrap_16.speaker: Narrator
DisarmingTrap_16.text: *Your candour does little to improve your situation. The guards will handle this.*

DisarmingTrap_26.speaker: Narrator
DisarmingTrap_26.text: *One of these days, your candour will pay off. Sadly it won't be today. You're going to prison.*

DisarmingTrap_13.speaker: Narrator
DisarmingTrap_13.text: *The mystery of the disarmed trap approaches its conclusion. Sadly, you may not be alive to see it.*

DisarmingTrap_1.speaker: Player
DisarmingTrap_1.text: Talk your way out of it.

DisarmingTrap_5.speaker: Narrator
DisarmingTrap_5.text: *You quickly establish your innocence. Clearly this wasn't your doing.*

DisarmingTrap_15.speaker: Player
DisarmingTrap_15.text: Talk your way out of it.

DisarmingTrap_25.speaker: Player
DisarmingTrap_25.text: I'm flattered you think me capable, but your traps are of no interest to me.

DisarmingTrap_20.speaker: Player
DisarmingTrap_20.text: I don't take kindly to being accused. I take violently, and with a lot of stabbing.

DisarmingTrap_4.speaker: Narrator
DisarmingTrap_4.text: *You'll walk free, for now, but your stories won't land so well if you're caught again.*

DisarmingTrap_12.speaker: Narrator
DisarmingTrap_12.text: *Your response is effective. This was simply a misunderstanding. You're free to go.*

DisarmingTrap_7.speaker: Narrator
DisarmingTrap_7.text: *First you break the rules, then you lie to get out of trouble. The guards will be hearing of this.*

DisarmingTrap_3.speaker: Narrator
DisarmingTrap_3.text: *Your words are of no interest. All that matters is that you end up in a cold, dark cell.*

DisarmingTrap_6.speaker: Narrator
DisarmingTrap_6.text: *You speak, but you are not listened to. This will be decided one way: violently.*

DisarmingTrap_21.speaker: Player
DisarmingTrap_21.text: The tamperer went that way! Didn't you see?

DisarmingTrap_17.speaker: Player
DisarmingTrap_17.text: Perhaps some gold would resolve this? ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_6057ad05-9492-4630-9f0a-be548b134c54])

DisarmingTrap_2.speaker: Narrator
DisarmingTrap_2.text: *Improperly-acquired coin weighs heavy on the conscience. The bribe may have worked this time, but it won't work the next.*

DisarmingTrap_19.speaker: Narrator
DisarmingTrap_19.text: *The clink of gold into a welcoming palm. The sound of repercussions deftly avoided.*

DisarmingTrap_8.speaker: Narrator
DisarmingTrap_8.text: *Paying someone off requires something to pay them with. You don't have the gold.*

DisarmingTrap_18.speaker: Narrator
DisarmingTrap_18.text: *The price of freedom runs higher than you thought. A prison cell beckons...*

DisarmingTrap_28.speaker: Narrator
DisarmingTrap_28.text: *Gold saves you from many confrontations, but not this one.*

Assault_6.speaker: Narrator
Assault_6.text: *There's been a violent assault in the area. You may want to confirm your innocence. Or your guilt.*

Assault_2.speaker: Player
Assault_2.text: That's nothing to do with me.

Assault_14.speaker: Narrator
Assault_14.text: *Your honesty speaks for itself. It seems you're free to go.*

Assault_20.speaker: Player
Assault_20.text: Try and talk your way out of this.

Assault_21.speaker: Player
Assault_21.text: It was a rogue Mage Hand. I'm sure it's long faded by now.

Assault_10.speaker: Player
Assault_10.text: Give a deep and menacing growl.

Assault_9.speaker: Narrator
Assault_9.text: *You'll walk free, for now, but your stories won't land so well if you're caught again.*

Assault_23.speaker: Narrator
Assault_23.text: *That settles it. You won't be disturbed any further.*

Assault_19.speaker: Narrator
Assault_19.text: *Freedom demands a high price, and your speech was not valuable enough. You're headed for the cells.*

Assault_18.speaker: Narrator
Assault_18.text: *If your intention was to make the situation worse, you certainly succeeded.*

Assault_17.speaker: Player
Assault_17.text: The odd fight is good for you! It gets the blood pumping.

Assault_25.speaker: Player
Assault_25.text: Maybe we can come to an arrangement. ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_6057ad05-9492-4630-9f0a-be548b134c54])

Assault_0.speaker: Narrator
Assault_0.text: *Improperly-acquired coin weighs heavy on the conscience. The bribe may have worked this time, but it won't work the next.*

Assault_7.speaker: Narrator
Assault_7.text: *Your little contribution soon clears things up. You're free to go.*
Assault_7.context: NodeContext: Don't allow infinite bribing for assault, not even for civilians

Assault_26.speaker: Narrator
Assault_26.text: *Perhaps some more gold would be helpful in making your offer.*
Assault_26.context: NodeContext: Don't allow infinite bribing for assault, not even for civilians

Assault_5.speaker: Narrator
Assault_5.text: *Your attempted bribery has caused offence. It looks like you're destined for the cells.*

Assault_15.speaker: Narrator
Assault_15.text: *Perhaps it was unwise to reveal just how much gold you have on your person.*

Assault_13.speaker: Player
Assault_13.text: You're in luck. I'm the culprit.

Assault_8.speaker: Narrator
Assault_8.text: *Your admission wasn't enough to absolve you of your crimes. Only time in the cells will do that.*

Assault_12.speaker: Narrator
Assault_12.text: *You sense the pleasantries might be over. In fact, this could get very unpleasant indeed.*

19.speaker: Narrator
19.text: *A crime's been committed, and this guard's decided to investigate. Investigate you, to be specific.*

6.speaker: Player
6.text: Try talking your way out of the situation.

26.speaker: Player
26.text: I've got a lead on the true culprit. Leave me be so I can follow it.

14.speaker: Player
14.text: I wouldn't go pointing fingers, unless you want them snapped off.

3.speaker: Player
3.text: You seem very stressed. Why don't you take a break? This miscreant can wait.

4.speaker: Narrator
4.text: *You'll walk free, for now, but your stories won't land so well if you're caught again.*

13.speaker: Narrator
13.text: *The accusation is withdrawn. It's wisest not to accuse you of this particular crime.*

17.speaker: Narrator
17.text: *Freedom demands a high price, and your speech was not valuable enough. You're headed for the cells.*

8.speaker: Narrator
8.text: *If your guilt wasn't confirmed before, it is now. The guards are being summoned.*

5.speaker: Narrator
5.text: *Your speech isn't persuasive. You sense this will be resolved in a more violent manner.*

0.speaker: Player
0.text: Would some gold help you find the real offender? ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_6057ad05-9492-4630-9f0a-be548b134c54])

1.speaker: Narrator
1.text: *Improperly-acquired coin weighs heavy on the conscience. The bribe may have worked this time, but it won't work the next.*

16.speaker: Narrator
16.text: *Your gold was more than enough to defuse the situation. You're free to go.*

21.speaker: Narrator
21.text: *You don't have the gold to buy your way out of this situation.*

23.speaker: Narrator
23.text: *Your bribe only reveals the truth: you're the criminal, and criminals belong in a cell.*

2.speaker: Narrator
2.text: *Your gold is good for many situations, but apparently not here. You're going to pay in blood.*

7.speaker: Narrator
7.text: *A criminal would never speak with such integrity. You must be innocent.*

24.speaker: Narrator
24.text: *There's a hunt underway. A crime has been reported, and you appear to be under suspicion.*

Steal_12.speaker: Narrator
Steal_12.text: *A theft has been reported, and it seems you're the only suspect. Choose your next step wisely.*

Steal_8.speaker: Narrator
Steal_8.text: *You surrender any offending items. It's like it never happened.*

Steal_1.speaker: Narrator
Steal_1.text: *Your apparent naivety is not convincing enough. Accident or not, you're about to be arrested.*

Steal_22.speaker: Narrator
Steal_22.text: *You return the offending items, but your crimes must still be answered for.*

Steal_10.speaker: Player
Steal_10.text: Try to talk your way out of the situation.

Steal_26.speaker: Player
Steal_26.text: I heard the thief's already been caught.

Steal_6.speaker: Player
Steal_6.text: Go on, accuse me of something. See what happens.

Steal_20.speaker: Narrator
Steal_20.text: *You'll walk free, for now, but your stories won't land so well if you're caught again.*

Steal_7.speaker: Narrator
Steal_7.text: *Your silken words deflect any suspicion. Your presence here is beyond reproach.*

Steal_14.speaker: Narrator
Steal_14.text: *Your words have only made you appear more guilty. The guards will be hearing of this.*

Steal_21.speaker: Narrator
Steal_21.text: *You try to sound convincing, without success. It appears a prison cell beckons.*

Steal_25.speaker: Narrator
Steal_25.text: *Your little speech isn't enough to hide your guilt. You'll have to resolve this in a bloodier fashion.*

Steal_23.speaker: Player
Steal_23.text: Sorry, I haven't seen anything suspicious.

Steal_0.speaker: Player
Steal_0.text: Perhaps a little gold could smooth this over? ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_6057ad05-9492-4630-9f0a-be548b134c54])

Steal_9.speaker: Narrator
Steal_9.text: *Improperly-acquired coin weighs heavy on the conscience. The bribe may have worked this time, but it won't work the next.*

Steal_19.speaker: Narrator
Steal_19.text: *Your gold is adequate compensation. There are few problems it can't solve.*

Steal_2.speaker: Narrator
Steal_2.text: *You don't have the gold to buy your way out of this situation.*

Steal_3.speaker: Narrator
Steal_3.text: *You offer a generous sum, but gold cannot help you here. You're headed for the cells.*

Steal_11.speaker: Narrator
Steal_11.text: *Loosening your purse strings usually suffices, but not today. Your sins demand blood, not gold.*

Steal_28.speaker: Narrator
Steal_28.text: *Your stealing has caught someone's attention. What will you do?*
